page.title: 02PUBS AND RESTAURANTS
page.content: {PUBS} In this part of England a pub is more than just a building where alcohol can be bought and consumed: a village's pub can be it's main - and sometimes it's only - social gathering place. Of the four pubs in the area two, The Chafford Arms and The Grange, are owned by Whitbread and one, The Greyhound, by Courage. The remaining pub, the two hundred-year-old High Rocks Inn, is a free house. All have been pubs for at least fifty years. Each pub serves meals, but only the Grange and the Greyhound have seperate restaurants. All have beer gardens except The Greyhound, which is also the only one that offers accomodation. {RESTAURANTS} The only restaurant in the area, L'Etoile, serves french style meals. It has a licence, but meals cost more than in the pubs.
